sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"行为，行动"之意。
means: act ：一般指具体的、短暂的或个别的行为，强调行为的完成及其效果。
action ：普通用词，着重行动的过程。
deed ：较庄重用词，除泛指各种行为外，还可用于指某种高尚或伟大的行为，故常译作"功绩，业绩"。
operation ：多指一连串行动或行为的完成方式。
performance ：主要指行动的方式方法。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"法同，法规"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: law, constitution, regulation, code, rule, act
means: law ： 普通用词，泛指由最高当局所制订、立法机构所通过的任何成文或不成文的法规或条例。
constitution ： 指治理国家或国家在处理内外政务时所遵循的基本法律和原则；也指规章规则的汇集。
regulation ： 普通用词，指用于管理、指导或控制某系统或组织的规则、规定或原则等。
code ： 指某一阶层或社会所遵守的一整套法典、法规或法则；也可指与某一特殊活动或主题有关的规则。
rule ： 通常指机关、团体的规章、条例或比赛规则；也指对人行为、方法等所作的规定，还可指习俗所承认的规定。
act ： 指经立法机构通过并由行政管理签署的法案。

sentence.Network_en: He wants to act in concert with other nations.
sentence.Network_cn: 他想和其他国家采取一致行动。

sentence.Network_en: Politicians across the political spectrum have denounced the act.

sentence.Network_en: It was imperative that he act as naturally as possible.
sentence.Network_cn: 最重要的是他要做到尽可能自然。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin actus 'event, thing done', act- 'done', from the verb agere, reinforced by the French noun acte

entry.def: When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The deaths occurred when police acted to stop widespread looting and vandalism...
example.tran: 警方采取行动制止猖狂的打砸抢行为时有多人丧生。

example.ex: I do not doubt that the bank acted properly.
example.tran: 我毫不怀疑银行的处理方式是妥当的。

entry.def: If you act on advice or information, you do what has been advised or suggested.

example.ex: A patient will usually listen to the doctor's advice and act on it.
example.tran: 患者通常都会遵照医嘱行事。

entry.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.

example.ex: ...a gang of youths who were acting suspiciously...
example.tran: 一伙形迹可疑的年轻人

example.ex: He acted as if he hadn't heard any of it...
example.tran: 他表现得好像对此毫不知情。

entry.def: If someone or something acts as a particular thing, they have that role or function.

example.ex: He acted both as the ship's surgeon and as chaplain for the men.
example.tran: 他在船上为水手们兼作外科医生和牧师。

example.ex: ...the Cunard Princess, which acted as a support ship for American forces.
example.tran: 用作美军支援船的公主号冠达邮轮

entry.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they pretend to be something that they are not.

example.ex: Chris acted astonished as he examined the note...
example.tran: 克里斯检查记录时故作震惊状。

example.ex: Kenworthy had tried not to act the policeman.
example.tran: 肯沃西努力表现得不像个警察。

entry.def: When professionals such as lawyers act for you, or act on your behalf, they are employed by you to deal with a particular matter.

example.ex: ...the law firm that acted for Diana during her marriage split...
example.tran: 在戴安娜婚姻破裂期间为她做代理的法律事务所

example.ex: Because we travelled so much, Sam and I asked a broker to act on our behalf.
example.tran: 由于我们经常游历在外，我和萨姆便请了一位经纪人代表我们处理事务。

entry.def: If a force or substance acts on someone or something, it has a certain effect on them.

example.ex: He's taking a dangerous drug: it acts very fast on the central nervous system...
example.tran: 他正在服用一种危险的药物：这种药物能很快影响到中枢神经系统。

example.ex: A hypnotist can act upon the unconscious mind directly.
example.tran: 催眠师能直接作用于无意识思维。

entry.def: If you act, or act a part in a play or film, you have a part in it.

example.ex: She confessed to her parents her desire to act...
example.tran: 她向父母坦言了自己想演戏的愿望。

example.ex: She acted in her first film when she was 13 years old.
example.tran: 13岁时她出演了她的电影处女作。

entry.def: An act is a single thing that someone does.

example.ex: Language interpretation is the whole point of the act of reading...
example.tran: 阅读行为中关键在于对语言的理解。

example.ex: My insurance excludes acts of sabotage and damage done by weapons of war.
example.tran: 我购买的保险对于蓄意损坏以及战争中武器造成的损坏不予赔偿。

entry.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.

example.ex: There were moments when I wondered: did she do this on purpose, was it all just a game, an act?...
example.tran: 有时我很困惑：她这么做是故意的吗？难道一切都只是一场游戏，是逢场作戏？

example.ex: His anger was real. It wasn't an act.
example.tran: 他是真的生气了，不是在摆样子。

entry.def: An Act is a law passed by the government.

example.ex: ...an Act of Parliament.
example.tran: 议会法案

entry.def: An act in a play, opera, or ballet is one of the main parts into which it is divided.

example.ex: Act II contained one of the funniest scenes I have ever witnessed...
example.tran: 第二幕里有我看过的最搞笑的场面之一。

entry.def: An act in a show is a short performance which is one of several in the show.

example.ex: This year numerous bands are playing, as well as comedy acts...
example.tran: 今年除了那些搞笑短剧外，还会有众多乐队登台献艺。

entry.def: If you catch someone in the act, you discover them doing something wrong or committing a crime.

example.ex: The men were caught in the act of digging up buried explosives.
example.tran: 那些人在挖掘掩埋的爆炸物时被逮个正着。

entry.def: If someone who has been behaving badly cleans up their act, they start to behave in a more acceptable or responsible way.

example.ex: The nation's advertisers need to clean up their act.
example.tran: 该国的广告商需要规范自己的行为。

entry.tran: （为了得到好处等）参与，插一手
entry.def: If you get in on the act, you take part in or take advantage of something that was started by someone else.

example.ex: In the 1970s Kodak, anxious to get in on the act, launched its own instant camera.
example.tran: 20世纪70年代，急于分一杯羹的柯达公司推出了自己的拍立得相机。

entry.def: You say that someone was in the act of doing something to indicate what they were doing when they were seen or interrupted.

example.ex: Ken was in the act of paying his bill when Neil came up behind him.
example.tran: 当尼尔从后面走过来时，肯正在付账。

entry.tran: 全力以赴；集中精力；劲儿往一处使
entry.def: If you get your act together, you organize your life or your affairs so that you are able to achieve what you want or to deal with something effectively.

example.ex: The Government should get its act together...
example.tran: 政府应该集中力量。

example.ex: We have to get our act together — we have to organize ourselves.
example.tran: 我们必须把劲儿往一处使——我们得组织起来。

means.word_mean: 1. a legal document codifying the result of deliberations of a committee or society or legislative body
2. something that people do or cause to happen
3. a subdivision of a play or opera or ballet
4. a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program;

sentences.sentence: "he did his act three times every evening"
"it was one of the best numbers he ever did"

means.word_mean: 5. a manifestation of insincerity;

sentences.sentence: "he put on quite an act for her benefit"

means.word_mean: 1. perform an action, or work out or perform (an action);

sentences.sentence: "The governor should act on the new energy bill"
"The nanny acted quickly by grabbing the toddler and covering him with a wet towel"

means.word_mean: 2. behave in a certain manner; show a certain behavior; conduct or comport oneself;

sentences.sentence: "The dog acts ferocious, but he is really afraid of people"

means.word_mean: 3. play a role or part;

sentences.sentence: "She wants to act Lady Macbeth, but she is too young for the role"
"She played the servant to her husband's master"

means.word_mean: 4. discharge one's duties;
5. pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind;

sentences.sentence: "She plays deaf when the news are bad"

means.word_mean: 6. be suitable for theatrical performance;
7. have an effect or outcome; often the one desired or expected;

sentences.sentence: "The voting process doesn't work as well as people thought"
"How does your idea work in practice?"
"The breaks of my new car act quickly"
"The medicine works only if you take it with a lot of water"

means.word_mean: 8. be engaged in an activity, often for no particular purpose other than pleasure
9. behave unnaturally or affectedly;
10. perform on a stage or theater;

list.explanation: [戏剧用语]无对白的杂耍歌舞节目(通常为一场演出的开场戏)
(为了宣传或推销等目的而精心安排的)盛举、盛大表演或讲演等事

example.en: Bring them in here and do a dog and pony act.
example.zh: 把他们领进来开开眼界见见大世面。

example.en: Wally was there with his dog and pony show about water safety.
example.zh: 韦利曾在那里作过关于水上保险的演讲。

auth_sentence.res_content: Portico Quartet are one such act to have flourished.

auth_sentence.res_content: The fused bones act as a single bony structure.

auth_sentence.content: Kyle Eastwood's band are a hot live act.

act行动,活动,做→v.行动,行为,扮演 n.[戏]幕

Sentence.sentence: Just as peer-to-peer businesses like eBay allow anyone to become a retailer, sharing sites let individuals act as an ad hoc ( 临时的) taxi service, car-hire firm or boutique hotel (精品酒店) as and when it suits them.
Yes, but I was going to say I thought the acting was terrible.
In mixed schools boys feel compelled to act like men before they understand themselves well enough to know what that means, " the study reported

means.word_mean: 做，做事，行事；行动，采取行动

sentences.en: The time for thinking is past, we must now act.
sentences.cn: 思考的时间过去了, 我们现在必须行动。

means.word_mean: 表演, 举动像…;装出,假装,做作
行为, 行动

sentences.en: My first act was to run into the waiting room.
sentences.cn: 我的第一个行动就是跑进客厅。

means.word_mean: (立法机关的)决议；敕命；法案；法令；条例

sentences.en: The drug was banned by an act of parliament.
sentences.cn: 议会的法案明令禁止该药品。

means.word_mean: (一)幕

sentences.en: Most modern plays have three acts.
sentences.cn: 大多数现代戏剧有三幕。

means.word_mean: 使举止与…相称
对…发生作用，起作用，对…产生影响(常与on连用)；奏效，见效

sentences.en: The medicine acted on her fever at once.
sentences.cn: 这药很快就使她退了烧。

means.word_mean: 表现，举止

sentences.en: The soldier acted like a real hero.
sentences.cn: 那个士兵的举动像一个真正的英雄。

means.word_mean: (在舞台上)表演，演戏，扮演角色

sentences.en: He acted in two plays by Molière.
sentences.cn: 他在莫里哀编的两个剧中扮演角色。

means.word_mean: (角色、戏等)能被(扮)演，(角色)适于扮演；(剧本)适于上演
似乎在演戏，做戏，假装，做作

sentences.en: The girl's not really crying; she's only acting to get your sympathy.
sentences.cn: 这女孩不是真哭，而是在做戏以博得你的同情。

means.word_mean: 对…做出决定(或裁决)；颁发奖品(常与on 连用)

sentences.en: We are required to act at the end of the meeting.
sentences.cn: 我们必须在会议结束时做出决定。

means.word_mean: 作代言人，作为…的代理人，代理，代办，代表(for)

sentences.en: As the chairman is ill, I am asking Mr Jones to act for him.
sentences.cn: 现在主席病了，我打算请琼斯先生代理他。

means.word_mean: 显出

jushi.english: He paid for the foolhardy act with his life.
jushi.chinese: 他为鲁莽的举动付出了生命的代价。

jushi.english: The act was passed by Congress and went into effect in August,1980.
jushi.chinese: 这项法令由国会通过,于1980年8月生效。

jushi.english: That's one true act of friendship.
jushi.chinese: 那是一种真正友好的行为。
